text: Philip Arthur Larkin CH, CBE, FRSL (9 August 1922 â€“ 2 December 1985) was a English poet and novelist.Encyclopedia Britannica Larkin was born and raised in Coventry, Warwickshire, where he attended primary and secondary school. He graduated from St John's College, Oxford with a double first in English language and literature. Larkin spent the latter years of his life in Hull, where he was a librarian at the University of Hull. Larkin died in Hull, Humberside, of oesophageal cancer. == References == Category:Alumni of the University of Oxford Category:English novelists Category:English poets Category:People from Coventry Category:1922 births Category:1985 deaths Category:Writers from West Midlands (county)
title: Philip Larkin
